channel.title: Automatic deobber
channel.description: ive tried to find it, but the one i found can no longer be downloaded is there a mirror server from where i can download it. thanks

item.title: Automatic deobber
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:26, topic:159423”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=217094.msg1895844#msg1895844 date=1195929868]

There are some people like me, who know enough of the client like they did in the Aryan timeperk. But we just don’t release it.
[/quote]sry but lol

I also ment you with it, but I’m getting serious doubts sometimes. You always flame on people who are learning and even on people who have proven to have the knowlage. I didn’t put myself next to the creators of Aryan. But I know for sure, that I know equaly about this client as Taios/Nerice of that client.[/quote]frank_ is human and is therefore a victim of imperfection. However, to have “serious doubts” that he is on par with you in knowledge of the Runescape client is doubleplus unsmart, to express it best.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic deobber

item.description:
@Hxp wrote:

could someone tell me what im doing wrong, im using saev’s deobber and the rsclient is in the same directory as run.xml and the deob.bat

C:>deob apply run.xml
could not read jar file “rscclient.jar”: java.io.FileNotFoundException: rscclient.jar (The system cannot find the file specified)
fatal: could not parse run.xml
Press any key to continue . . .

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/saev/deob/Main

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 26, 2007, 12:35:10 AM[/size][hr]nvm fixed that error finally got the

ive put the rsc jar file in the directory

item.title: Automatic deobber
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:29, topic:159423”][quote author=qauters link=topic=217094.msg1899601#msg1899601 date=1196051349]

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=217094.msg1899590#msg1899590 date=1196051094]

[quote author=qauters link=topic=217094.msg1899537#msg1899537 date=1196049669]

There are some people like me, who know enough of the client like they did in the Aryan timeperk. But we just don’t release it.
[/quote]sry but lol

I also ment you with it, but I’m getting serious doubts sometimes. You always flame on people who are learning and even on people who have proven to have the knowlage. I didn’t put myself next to the creators of Aryan. But I know for sure, that I know equaly about this client as Taios/Nerice of that client.
[/quote]tbh taios never seemed to know much about the client

Enough to update Aryan and to be one of the developpers of ARGA. Why need to know more about the client, then is enough to make a bot
[/quote]to understand it… i have a genuine interest in it, however i havent been bothered lately[/quote]
Ofcourse you need to understand it, otherwise you can’t even think about making a bot. I’ve been renaming 473 just to learn more about it. It’s just that you need a lot of time to make it perfect. Time is something I don’t have

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic deobber
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

well saevion has the file build.xml which has the information for compiling the program, (and doing other stuff like making javadocs and all that)

you use it with a program called Apache Ant, IMO its really great, i installed it because i saw saevions advice, and iv never gone back

when you install it, go to the directory of the program in the command line interpreter of your platform, and write "ant " where is one of the ones in the build file (look in the comment of build.xml for the targets)

and before you do anything, read the readme.txt, it has some important information you might want to know

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic deobber
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“RLN, post:18, topic:159423”][quote author=_cake link=topic=217094.msg1892131#msg1892131 date=1195781067]

[quote author=RLN link=topic=217094.msg1892111#msg1892111 date=1195780564]

@yakman: It set an array that described the action under the mouse. For example you hovered your mouse over a NPC and it would say actionArray = {“Attack NPC”,123(the id for “fight”),some other crap…} - obviously its not a String[]. Then it just simulated a click somewhere in the client screen.

RS ran like this: {grab data from server, update internal data to reflect server, figure out where user had clicked} and then it did {send user actions to server}. By injecting between those two it was able to click anywhere. Since the action was “forced” (the array was set), it didn’t matter what point you clicked on because the game hadn’t had a chance to update the current action under the mouse. I haven’t had a good look at the code but this is the general idea. I will send you a copy of Aryan (whatever version i can dig up), when someone un-moderates me.
[/quote]the fuck? bots just sent the packet for whatever you wanted it to do

wtf do you mean? aryan wasn’t a packet bot
[/quote]thought we were talking about rsc[/quote] olol that explains it I guess

Read full topic

RS ran like this: {grab data from server, update internal data to reflect server, figure out where user had clicked} and then it did {send user actions to server}. By injecting between those two it was able to click anywhere. Since the action was “forced” (the array was set), it didn’t matter what point you clicked on because the game hadn’t had a chance to update the current action under the mouse. I haven’t had a good look at the code but this is the general idea. I will send you a copy of Aryan (whatever version i can dig up), when someone un-moderates me.

item.title: Automatic deobber
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:8, topic:159423”]heres a copy of saevion’s deobfuscator if thats the one you want, i learnt a lot from this, that saevion was good, too bad i never met him

i heard this program powered aryan, so i guess after every update, you would run this and rename some by hand or whatever.

so does anyone have an old copy of aryan, I’m not talking about a well renamed deob, but the whole thing, like the script system, the accessor methods thingy, those batch files called “run.bat”, “compile-scripts.bat”, “compile-controllers.bat”, “compile-randoms.bat”, and perhaps some old scripts as well, like a essence miner, yew chopper and stuff.
and what are those controllers?

its funny about the way it walked, i heard it just clicked anywhere and replaced some walking array
and what about the people around at the time, i know about regex, SeanWT, but people who hung around and knew about stuff.
I once heard someone say, “but with aryan, we had much more competant developers than we had today”, so who where they?

in case you haven’t realised, i never used aryan, and im using this chance to ask loads of questions about it :rolleyes:

heres saevion’s deobfuscator[/quote]
Controllers where script that would run multiple script. Like checking tutIsland, quest if all done, run Essence Miner.
People who developed around then where Taios, Nerice and ‘Impsoft’, there where more, but I was member of their sites (except IMPSoft). Badly enough they both stopped/disapeared. (I saw Nerice once in a while though). There are some people like me, who know enough of the client like they did in the Aryan timeperk. But we just don’t release it.

Here are some Aryan things, I’ve downloaded recently. I lost all my Aryans from that time, because of a hard format
http://rapidshare.com/files/71503674/all_aryans.rar.html

Read full topic

item.title: Automatic deobber
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

@yakman: It set an array that described the action under the mouse. For example you hovered your mouse over a NPC and it would say actionArray = {“Attack NPC”,123(the id for “fight”),some other crap…} - obviously its not a String[]. Then it just simulated a click somewhere in the client screen.

RS ran like this: {grab data from server, update internal data to reflect server, figure out where user had clicked} and then it did {send user actions to server}. By injecting between those two it was able to click anywhere. Since the action was “forced” (the array was set), it didn’t matter what point you clicked on because the game hadn’t had a chance to update the current action under the mouse. I haven’t had a good look at the code but this is the general idea. I will send you a copy of Aryan (whatever version i can dig up), when someone un-moderates me.

Read full topic
